sect2.title: Prevent number_format from returning negative zero
sect2.para: Previously, it was possible for the number_format function to return -0. Whilst this is perfectly valid according to the IEEE 754 floating point specification, this oddity was not desirable for displaying formatted numbers in a human-readable form.

informalexample.programlisting:
<?php
var_dump(number_format(-0.01)); // now outputs string(1) "0" instead of string(2) "-0"

sect2.title: Convert numeric keys in object and array casts
sect2.para: Numeric keys are now better handled when casting arrays to object and objects to arrays (either from explicit casting or by settype).
This means that integer (or stringy integer) keys from arrays being casted to objects are now accessible:
sect2.informalexample:
<?php

// array to object
$arr = [0 => 1];
$obj = (object)$arr;
var_dump(
    $obj,
    $obj->{'0'}, // now accessible
    $obj->{0} // now accessible
);

   
   &example.outputs;
   

object(stdClass)#1 (1) {
  ["0"]=>    // string key now, rather than integer key
  int(1)
}
int(1)
int(1)
sect2.para: And integer (or stringy integer) keys from objects being casted to arrays are now accessible:
sect2.informalexample:
<?php

// object to array
$obj = new class {
    public function __construct()
    {
        $this->{0} = 1;
    }
};
$arr = (array)$obj;
var_dump(
    $arr,
    $arr[0], // now accessible
    $arr['0'] // now accessible
);

   
   &example.outputs;
   

array(1) {
  [0]=>    // integer key now, rather than string key
  int(1)
}
int(1)
int(1)

sect2.title: Disallow Passing &null; to get_class
sect2.para: Previously, passing &null; to the get_class function would output the name of the enclosing class. This behaviour has now been removed, where an E_WARNING will be output instead. To achieve the same behaviour as before, the argument should simply be omitted instead.

sect2.title: Warn when counting non-countable types
sect2.para: An E_WARNING will now be emitted when attempting to count non-countable types (this includes the sizeof alias function).
sect2.informalexample:
<?php
var_dump( count(1), // integers are not countable count('abc'), // strings are not countable count(new stdclass), // objects not implementing the Countable interface are not countable count([1,2]) // arrays are countable );
&example.outputs;
Warning: count(): Parameter must be an array or an object that implements Countable in %s on line %d
Warning: count(): Parameter must be an array or an object that implements Countable in %s on line %d
Warning: count(): Parameter must be an array or an object that implements Countable in %s on line %d int(1) int(1) int(1) int(2)

sect2.title: Move ext/hash from resources to objects
sect2.para: As part of the long-term migration away from resources, the Hash extension has been updated to use objects instead of resources. The change should be seamless for PHP developers, except for where is_resource checks have been made (which will need updating to is_object instead).

sect2.title: Improve SSL/TLS Defaults
sect2.para: The following changes to the defaults have been made:

listitem.simpara: tls:// now defaults to TLSv1.0 or TLSv1.1 or TLSv1.2
STREAM_CRYPTO_METHOD_TLS_* constants default to TLSv1.0 or TLSv1.1 + TLSv1.2, instead of TLSv1.0 only
